program_description.description: Identifies a Mobius capacity by means of an approach grounded on least squares optimization. More precisely, given a set of overall values for each alternative, and possibly additional linear constraints expressing preferences, importance of criteria, etc., this algorithm determines, if it exists, a capacity minimising the sum of squared errors between overall scores as given by the data and the output of the Choquet integral for those data, and compatible with the additional linear constraints. The existence is ensured if no additional constraint is given. The problem is solved using quadratic programming.

parameter.name: kAdditivity
parameter.description: Indicates the level of k-additivity of the Mobius capacity (the Mobius transform of subsets whose cardinal is superior to k vanishes).

parameter.name: Supply kAdditivity as a file?
parameter.description: Supply kAdditivity as a file?

parameter.name: kAdditivity
parameter.description: Indicates the level of k-additivity of the Mobius capacity (the Mobius transform of subsets whose cardinal is superior to k vanishes).
parameter.code: #kAdditivity: kAdditivity.xml cat > kAdditivity.xml <<EOF%n<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="xmcdaKappalab.xsl"?> <xmcda:XMCDA xmlns:xmcda="http://www.decision-deck.org/2009/XMCDA-2.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.decision-deck.org/2009/XMCDA-2.0.0 http://www.decision-deck.org/xmcda/_downloads/XMCDA-2.0.0.xsd">

parameter.name: kAdditivity
parameter.description: TODO

constraint.description: The value should be a positive integer, less than or equal to the number of criteria.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: A list of criteria. Criteria can be activated or desactivated via the <active> tag (true or false). By default (no <active> tag), criteria are considered as active.

parameter.name: alternatives
parameter.description: A list of alternatives. Alternatives can be activated or desactivated via the <active> tag (true or false). By default (no <active> tag), alternatives are considered as active.

parameter.name: performanceTable
parameter.description: A performance table. The evaluations should be numeric values, i.e. <real>, <integer> or <rational>.

parameter.name: shapleyPreorder
parameter.description: A valued relation on criteria expressing importance constraints on the critera. A numeric <value> indicates a minimal preference threshold for each <pair>. One <pair> represents an affirmation of the type "the Shapley importance index of criterion g1 is greater than the Shapley importance index of criterion g2 with preference threshold delta".

parameter.name: Use shapleyPreorder as input?
parameter.description: Use shapleyPreorder as input?

parameter.name: shapleyInterval
parameter.description: A list of <criterionValue> containing the constraints relative to the quantitative importance of the criteria. Each <criterionValue> contains an an <interval>. Each <criteriaValue> represents an affirmation of the type "the Shapley importance index of criterion g1 lies in the interval [a,b]".

parameter.name: Use shapleyInterval as input?
parameter.description: Use shapleyInterval as input?

parameter.name: interactionPreorder
parameter.description: A valued relation on pairs of criteria expressing constraints on value of the the Shapley interaction index. A numeric <value> indicates a minimal preference threshold for each <pair> of the relation. One <pair> represents a constraint of the type "the Shapley interaction index of the pair (g1,g2) of criteria is greater than the Shapley interaction index of the pair (g3,g4) of criteria with preference threshold delta".

parameter.name: Use interactionPreorder as input?
parameter.description: Use interactionPreorder as input?

parameter.name: interactionInterval
parameter.description: A list of <criterionValue> containing the constraints relative to the type and the magnitude of the Shapley interaction index for pairs of criteria. Each <criterionValue> contains an an <interval>. Each <criteriaValue> represents an affirmation of the type "the Shapley interaction index of the pair (g1,g2) of criteria lies in the interval [a,b]".

parameter.name: Use interactionInterval as input?
parameter.description: Use interactionInterval as input?

parameter.name: overallValues
parameter.description: A list of <alternativeValue> containing the desired overall value of each alternative. The <value> should be a numeric value.

parameter.name: messages
parameter.description: A list of messages generated by the algorithm.

parameter.name: mobiusCapacity
parameter.description: The Mobius transform of a capacity.

parameter.name: residuals
parameter.description: A list of <alternativeValue> representing the difference between the provided overall evaluations and those returned by the obtained model, for each alternative.

parameter.name: Timeout? (0 for no timeout)
parameter.description: timeout

constraint.description: value should be a positive or null integer
